business.headline: Moody's keeps India's Baa3 rating unchanged with stable outlookMoody's said India's strengths include its large and fast-growing economy, a sound external position, and a stable domestic financing base for fiscal deficits.

Beyond metros: How festive cheer boosts real estate demand in Tier-2 citiesWhile metros grab most of the headlines, smaller cities are quietly stealing the show. With festivals around the corner, Tier-2 cities are witnessing a strong spike in property interest and sales.

Lufthansa layoffs: German airline plans 4,000 job cuts over next 5 yearsThe job cuts will mainly affect administrative roles rather than operational positions such as pilots, cabin crew or ground staff.

Does EPFO's new ECR system simplify return filing for employers?The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has launched a revamped electronic challan-cum-return (ECR) system, aiming to make return filing easier and more accurate for employers. But does it really simplify the process?

Will RBI announce a rate cut in the upcoming MPC meeting? Here's what to expectThe Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee begins its three-day meeting to decide whether it is time to cut interest rates or hold steady. With inflation easing and growth signals mixed, all eyes are on what the central bank does next.
Experts reveal best festive stocks to buy amid global uncertaintyConcerns over global trade talks with the US and new protectionist measures have weighed on investor sentiment
Sensex opens 142 points higher, Nifty above 24,500; BEL gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 114.15 points to 80,540.61, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 36.45 points to 24,691.15 as of 9:24 am.

Arattai success proves why Zoho won't rush going public, says Sridhar VembuIn a post on X, Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu said that some of Zoho's key projects, such as its messaging app Arattai, would have never been built under the financial pressures faced by public companies.

LIC sees Rs 1,100 crore inflows on Day 1 of GST-free life cover: ReportLife Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) collected over Rs 1,100 crore in inflows on the first day following the removal of GST on individual life insurance policies.
Insured, but where is the protection?Despite the recent reform of zero GST, insurance remains an opaque industry where customers struggle to understand what they're actually buying.

Buying home this festive season? Top things to check before Griha PraveshaFamilies often see this period as the most auspicious time to make a big investment like a home, but experts warn that it is also the stage when due diligence becomes most important.

Nirav Modi's brother-in-law Maiank Mehta pardoned in Rs 13,000 crore PNB scam caseA special CBI court granted pardon to Maiank Mehta, brother-in-law of fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi, in the Rs 13,000 crore Punjab National Bank fraud case.

entertainment.headline: BTS' V and IVE's Jang Wonyoung dating? Internet discovers alleged proof Online speculation grew over a possible relationship between BTS' V and IVE's Jang Wonyoung. Social media users shared a 'proof list' connecting the two K-pop idols.

Just did my job: Actor Ashish Kumar on his cop act in The Ba***ds of Bollywood Actor Ashish Kumar responded to the allegations about how his character is allegedly based on Sameer Wankhede. Former NCB officer Wankhede sued Aryan Khan, Shah Rukh Khan, and Netflix for defamation.

Ranbir Kapoor to commence shoot for Sandeep Reddy Vanga's Animal Park in 2027 Actor Ranbir Kapoor announced that the shoot for Animal Park will begin in 2027. This update comes as he prepares for two major film releases in 2026, signalling a busy schedule ahead.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12 goes on air, Kichcha Sudeep introduces nineteen contestants Bigg Boss Kannada 12 returns with Kichcha Sudeep as the host and a new 'Onti vs Janti' twist, pitting solo and duo contestants against each other.

Homebound: Why Neeraj Ghaywan's film deserves to be India's Oscar entry Filmmaker Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' has received an overwhelming response from fans and critics alike. Selected as India's official Oscar entry, the film proved that it is the country's best bet after 'Laapataa Ladies'.

Demon Slayer's Akaza voice actor Lucien Dodge talks film and fan love In an exclusive interview, Lucien Dodge opens up on voicing Akaza in 'Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle', from his tragic past to becoming anime's most loved anti-hero.

Exclusive: How Rishab Shetty and his villagers brought Kantara Chapter 1 to life Ahead of 'Kantara: Chapter 1' release, actor Rishab Shetty shared in an exclusive conversation how his entire village was involved in the filmmaking process. He also spoke about the extensive research that went into the film.

Rise & Fall: Ashneer Grover walks out after heated exchange with Aarush Bhola Ashneer Grover and Aarush Bhola got into a heated argument on 'Rise & Fall'. The fallout saw Ashneer walking out, highlighting tensions on the show.

Shilpa Rao pays emotional tribute to late Zubeen Garg at Ziro Festival. Watch Singer Shilpa Rao paid a heartfelt tribute to the late Zubeen Garg at the Ziro Festival, performing a soulful rendition of 'Ya Ali'.

Jr NTR shows discomfort as he attends Kantara Hyderabad event despite injury Actor Jr NTR made a public appearance at the 'Kantara: Chapter 1' pre-release event in Hyderabad on Sunday. The actor was injured a few days prior during a commercial shoot.

Imtiaz Ali praises Diljit's Emmy nod as a moment of pride for India Imtiaz Ali's 'Chamkila' secured two International Emmy nominations, including nod for Diljit Dosanjh's performance. The filmmaker reflected on the film's journey and said that it wouldn't have been possible without Diljit.

Emraan Hashmi's Awarapan 2 goes on floors, shoot begins in Bangkok Emraan Hashmi is set to film the eagerly awaited sequel 'Awarapan 2'. The makers announced that they have begun the filming with the first schedule planned in Bangkok.

Ranbir Kapoor praises Lokah Chapter 1, shares favourite songs from his playlist Actor Ranbir Kapoor is all praise for 'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra' and its music. The film found a mention in an Instagram Live hosted by the actor on his birthday. The actor also shared the top songs on his music playlist. Hint: It includes a song from 'Saiyaara.'

All Spider-Man films to re-release in India this November Sony Pictures will re-release all major Spider-Man films in cinemas across India throughout November and early December, giving fans and new audiences the chance to experience every era of the superhero on the big screen.

Varun Dhawan handles complaint about driver's rash driving calmly in viral video A video of Varun Dhawan calmly handling a complaint about his driver's rash driving has gone viral, earning him widespread praise for his patience.

Actor Mahesh Manjrekar's 1st wife Deepa Mehta dies, son Satya shares tribute Actor-filmmaker Mahesh Manjrekar's first wife and renowned costume designer Deepa Mehta has died, as confirmed by their son Satya Manjrekar on social media. The Marathi film fraternity has expressed heartfelt condolences, remembering her contributions to cinema and her entrepreneurial success.

Aishwarya Rai in Paris with Aaradhya ahead of fashion week. Viral videos Actor Aishwarya Rai was in Paris with her daughter Aaradhya ahead of Paris Fashion Week. In the videos surfacing on social media, the actor can also be seen interacting with her fans.

BB19 episode 36: Harsh Gujral, Abhishek Malhan's roast leaves Tanya Mittal in tears Salman Khan hosted the 'Bigg Boss 19' Weekend Ka Vaar episode with the 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' team, featuring dance performances and interactions with the housemates. The episode included the eviction of Awez Darbar, emotional moments for Tanya Mittal, and humorous feedback from guests Abhishek Malhan and Harsh Gujral.

Big B teases Shoaib Akhtar's Abhishek goof up after India's Asia Cup win Amitabh Bachchan congratulated Team India after they defeated 'dushamn' Pakistan in the Asia Cup final match. In his post, the actor even jibed at Shoaib Akhtar's recent gaffe.

general news.headline: Silver stolen but spirit of gold: Champions India glitter despite Mohsin Naqvi heistAfter being denied of their moment in the spotlight by a lame attempt from PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi, the Indian team showed, through humour and passion, that their spirit will not be dimmed by any underhand tactics and celebrated their Asia Cup win.

Karur stampede FIR blames Vijay for arriving late, holding roadshow without nodThe Karur stampede FIR blames Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam chief Vijay for deliberately delaying his movement and conducting a roadshow without permission, worsening conditions that led to 41 deaths at the rally.

What the US wants – The Pakistan dictator playbookFrom Yahya Khan to Pervez Musharraf, Pakistan's army chiefs have played Washington's game with precision. Their true loyalty, it seems, has always been to the US playbook, not the people they rule.

Arattai app explodes 100x in 3 days as sign-ups soar from 3,000 to 350,000 dailyArattai, from Zoho is seeing a massive boost in popularity. The app has recorded a jump in daily sign-ups from 3,000 to 350,000 in just three days. Some users are also calling it a potential WhatsApp killer.

What's happening in the garb of the garba?Once a spiritual, community-centred dance in Gujarat, garba has now been commercialised. Its folk forms are dying in Gujarat itself, but the dance is uniting people across age groups, from Delhi to Bengaluru. The dhol beats and dandiya clicks might have been replaced by techno, but its new avatar still has the same old energy.

Pak couldn't kill him but...: Father on Kargil War veteran killed in Leh protestKargil war veteran Tsewang Tharchin, 46, who served in the Ladakh Scouts during the 1999 India-Pakistan War, was among the four protesters killed last week in police firing in Leh. His father, Stanzin Namgyal, also a Kargil veteran, had received a commendation from the Chief of Army Staff. Tharchin's family is demanding a fair probe.

India should push for Swadeshi tech but must keep hustlers awayThe Ping Browser episode exposed how India's Swadeshi tech push risks being undermined by shortcuts and grift. True self-reliance demands innovation, not copies disguised as indigenous products, and greater vigilance in execution.

Who disrupted BJP's 10-year winning streak in Assam?Assam, where the BJP has of late enjoyed an uninterrupted electoral run since 2016, has faced the first defeat as Hagrama Mohilary's Bodo People's Front (BPF) swept the 2025 Bodoland Territorial Council (BTC) elections. The sweep by Mohilary's BPF has disrupted the BJP's dominance, just ahead of the Assam Assembly election.

Faster than making Maggi: China cuts travel of 2 hours to 2 mins with highest bridgeSlashing travel time across the canyon from two hours to just two minutes, China has opened the Huajiang Grand Canyon Bridge in Guizhou, now the world's highest at 625 meters above the ground. Completed over more than three years, the bridge stretches 1,420 meters across the canyon.

You're getting angry: Suryakumar shuts down salty Pak reporter with witty remarkSuryakumar Yadav shut down a Pakistan reporter who questioned the Indian team's behaviour towards Pakistan during the Asia Cup 2025. India defeated Pakistan to win the title on Sunday, September 28.

Her 'Mann Ki Baat': PM Modi writes foreword to Giorgia Meloni's memoirPM Modi praised Meloni as a "patriot and outstanding contemporary leader" whose journey, he said, mirrors Indian values and would resonate with readers.

How 'I love Muhammad' row gives Yogi Adityanath ammo against Akhilesh YadavAnalysts say the issue, initially local, has been transformed into a broader ideological debate, allowing UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanth to consolidate support on a Hindutva platform during Navratri and force the Samajwadi Party into a balancing act.

NRI couple apologises for kissing at Vadodara Garba event after viral video outrageSoon after the video of the NRI couple surfaced, calls for strict action against them as well as the organisers of the Garba event in Vadodara began circulating online.

Clashes over 'I love Muhammad' rangoli in Maharashtra's Ahilyanagar; 30 detainedProtests broke out in Ahilyanagar after 'I love Muhammad' graffiti appeared in the Milliwada area, sparking road blockades by local youths. Police resorted to a lathicharge to disperse the demonstrators.

New script to spread propaganda: AAP, BJP spar over Asia Cup trophy dramaIndia's five-wicket victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup final in Dubai on Sunday night has received widespread praise from the nation's top political leadership, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who called the win "Operation Sindoor on the games field".

India refuse Asia Cup trophy from PCB chief, celebrate empty-handed on stageAsia Cup 2025 final, Ind vs Pak: In one of the most bizarre scenes in cricket history, the victorious Indian team celebrated without the trophy on the dais in Dubai. Suryakumar Yadav said India were denied the trophy after it emerged that the team refused to collect it from Pakistan Cricket Board chief Mohsin Naqvi.

Aspirin and heart attacks: The evidence, the risks, and the right way to use itIn India, where emergency medical access could sometimes be delayed by traffic snarls, hospital distances, or lack of immediate recognition, the question arises: can something as simple as chewing an aspirin buy a patient precious time?

Bengaluru residents perform havan in front of pothole in protest. Video viralA group of residents in Bengaluru performed a havan at a pothole near Tambuchetty Junction in protest, urging civic authorities to act on the city's road crisis.

Vijay's TVK sought brief power cut, letter shows amid rally stampede blame gameAmid a growing controversy over the Karur rally stampede, a letter from Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam reveals the party requested a temporary power shutdown citing public safety.

Indian rats: Hate graffiti in Canada amid Carney's bid to attract H-1B talentA hateful graffiti reading 'Indian rats' was found near a children's park in Mississauga, sparking outrage, with advocacy group CoHNA condemning it as racism and Hinduphobia. The incident coincided with Canadian PM Mark Carney's call for skilled Indian workers affected by the US' new H-1B policy to consider Canada.

Why society still doesn't understand postpartumFeeling alone during the postpartum period is common for new mothers. Yet, while they navigate life-altering physical and emotional changes, society often expects them to 'be normal,' overlooking the challenges they face.

Nasa races to deflect 1.4-ton observatory falling back to EarthSwift, launched in 2004 and parked in low-Earth orbit at around 585 km above the planet, is gradually losing altitude due to atmospheric drag.

Deeply concerned: X to appeal High Court order on complying with takedown noticesX announced it would appeal against a Karnataka High Court order enforcing compliance with takedown notices, warning it enables arbitrary directives by millions of police officers and threatens free expression.

Demon Slayer's Akaza voice actor Lucien Dodge talks film and fan loveIn an exclusive interview, Lucien Dodge opens up on voicing Akaza in 'Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle', from his tragic past to becoming anime's most loved anti-hero.

sports.headline: Silver stolen but spirit of gold: Champions India glitter despite Mohsin Naqvi heist After being denied of their moment in the spotlight by a lame attempt from PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi, the Indian team showed, through humour and passion, that their spirit will not be dimmed by any underhand tactics and celebrated their Asia Cup win.

Not collecting Asia Cup trophy will haunt India down the line: Shoaib Malik Former Pakistan captain Shoaib Malik has claimed that India will regret the decision not to collect the Asia Cup trophy after winning it on Sunday, September 28. India decided not to take the trophy from ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi after beating Pakistan by five wickets.

Varun Chakravarthy wakes up with Cup, trolls PCB chief Naqvi after Asia Cup drama Following India's Asia Cup 2025 triumph, Varun Chakravarthy humorously mocked the trophy fiasco with a tea cup post. The players celebrated creatively after PCB and ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi walked off with the actual trophy.

India's T20 competition is against Australia or England, not Pakistan: Harbhajan Singh Harbhajan Singh, while speaking exclusively to India Today, said that India's competition in T20s is with the likes of Australia, England or South Africa and not Pakistan after beating them in the Asia Cup final. Harbhajan feels that the gap with Pakistan is big at the moment.

Chamari Athapaththu goes for one last push in Sri Lanka's title hunt Sri Lanka return to the Women's World Cup after an eight-year absence, led by the legendary Chamari Athapaththu and a promising crop of youngsters, blending experience and youthful energy.

Asia Cup was all about India vs India: Harbhajan Singh plays down Pakistan rivalry Harbhajan Singh has claimed that the Asia Cup was always about how well India would perform in the tournament and said that the rivalry with Pakistan was well and truly over. India defeated Pakistan to win the Asia Cup 2025 final.

From bearded Vikings to smooth warriors: India complete cricket Ashwamedh India's Asia Cup 2025 triumph showcases a new generation carrying forward the legacy of bearded giants. Tilak Varma, Shivam Dube, and Abhishek Sharma emerge as game-changers, blending fire, skill, and calculated aggression.

Abhishek Sharma subtly jabs 'premium' pacer Shaheen Afridi after Asia Cup triumph Abhishek Sharma subtly took a dig at Pakistan's "premium" pacer Shaheen Afridi after India's Asia Cup 2025 triumph, reaffirming his aggressive intent from the powerplay while leading India to their ninth title.

Watch: Arshdeep, Harshit, Jitesh mimic Abrar Ahmed's celebration after win After India's Asia Cup final win over Pakistan, Arshdeep Singh, Harshit Rana, and Jitesh Sharma playfully mimicked Abrar Ahmed's head-tilt celebration. India won the title after winning by five wickets.

You're getting angry: Suryakumar shuts down salty Pak reporter with witty remark Suryakumar Yadav shut down a Pakistan reporter who questioned the Indian team's behaviour towards Pakistan during the Asia Cup 2025. India defeated Pakistan to win the title on Sunday, September 28.

Cricket was played in Asia Cup final. Tilak's day in the sun is proof of it Asia Cup final, India vs Pakistan: Long before the trophy fiasco unfolded at the Dubai stadium, Tilak Varma had crafted a masterclass knock against Pakistan in the high-pressure final, ensuring that cricket remained the true protagonist of the day.

From bearded Vikings to smooth warriors: India complete cricket Ashwamedh India's Asia Cup 2025 triumph showcases a new generation carrying forward the legacy of bearded giants. Tilak Varma, Shivam Dube, and Abhishek Sharma emerge as game-changers, blending fire, skill, and calculated aggression.

Abhishek Sharma subtly jabs 'premium' pacer Shaheen Afridi after Asia Cup triumph Abhishek Sharma subtly took a dig at Pakistan's "premium" pacer Shaheen Afridi after India's Asia Cup 2025 triumph, reaffirming his aggressive intent from the powerplay while leading India to their ninth title.

Watch: Arshdeep, Harshit, Jitesh mimic Abrar Ahmed's celebration after win After India's Asia Cup final win over Pakistan, Arshdeep Singh, Harshit Rana, and Jitesh Sharma playfully mimicked Abrar Ahmed's head-tilt celebration. India won the title after winning by five wickets.

You're getting angry: Suryakumar shuts down salty Pak reporter with witty remark Suryakumar Yadav shut down a Pakistan reporter who questioned the Indian team's behaviour towards Pakistan during the Asia Cup 2025. India defeated Pakistan to win the title on Sunday, September 28.

Cricket was played in Asia Cup final. Tilak's day in the sun is proof of it Asia Cup final, India vs Pakistan: Long before the trophy fiasco unfolded at the Dubai stadium, Tilak Varma had crafted a masterclass knock against Pakistan in the high-pressure final, ensuring that cricket remained the true protagonist of the day.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
